# clearpass_role (Resource)

Manages a user role in ClearPass. Roles define access levels and permissions for authenticated users. Common roles include [Employee] for full access, Guest for limited access, and custom roles for specific requirements. Roles are referenced by enforcement policies and role mapping rules.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "clearpass_role" "employee" {
  name        = "[Employee]"
  description = "Role assigned to company employees with full network access"
}

resource "clearpass_role" "guest" {
  name        = "Guest"
  description = "Limited access role for guest users"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Unique name of the role (e.g., 'Guest', '[Employee]', '[Contractor]'). System roles typically use square brackets.

### Optional

- `description` (String) Human-readable description explaining the role's purpose and intended use.

### Read-Only

- `id` (Number) Numeric ID of the role assigned by ClearPass. Used as the Terraform resource ID.

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Role can be imported by ID
terraform import clearpass_role.employee 123
```
